topic_metadata.title: How to get rid of a padding on the right side of block quotations?

posts.name: jsx97
posts.cooked:
It seems that block quotations have 1em inset on the left and right sides:

#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]

image1234×368 183 KB

I style block quotations with a stroke on the left side:

#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)
#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em, width: 100%)
#show quote.where(block: true): block.with(stroke: (left: 4pt + silver, rest: none))

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]

…and because of this, the inset on the right side looks redundant. How to get rid of it?

Addendum:

To solve this issue (and after all, I suspect this is not a really good way), I tried to add -1em negative inset, but for some reason it looks like -2. Neither -0.5 really works.

#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)
#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em, width: 100%, inset: (right: -1em))
#show quote.where(block: true): block.with(stroke: (left: 4pt + silver, rest: none))

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]

image1714×430 116 KB
posts.raw:
It seems that block quotations have 1em inset on the left and right sides:

```typ
#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]
```

![image|690x205, 75%](upload://qF1wZUlhq073yTEiONnnCfzNU4Y.png)

I style block quotations with a stroke on the left side:

```typ
#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)
#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em, width: 100%)
#show quote.where(block: true): block.with(stroke: (left: 4pt + silver, rest: none))

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]
```

![image|438x324, 45%](upload://xLyj3zn5C4BzoQJaKRPu7HUjIqP.png)

...and because of this, the inset on the right side looks redundant. How to get rid of it?

**Addendum:**

To solve this issue (and after all, I suspect this is not a really good way), I tried to add `-1em` negative inset, but for some reason it looks like `-2`. Neither `-0.5` really works.

```typ
#set par(first-line-indent: 1em, justify: true)
#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em, width: 100%, inset: (right: -1em))
#show quote.where(block: true): block.with(stroke: (left: 4pt + silver, rest: none))

#lorem(50)

#quote(block: true)[#lorem(50)]
```

![image|690x173](upload://nBclhytrNyHbQF1mRitcgyLqbpy.png)

posts.cooked:
An inset of about -0.35em seems to roughly work.

#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em,
width: 100%, inset: (right: -0.35em))

But this is not really a satisfying solution, because it seems arbitrary.
posts.raw:
An inset of about `-0.35em` seems to roughly work. 
```
#show quote.where(block: true): set block(spacing: 1em,
width: 100%, inset: (right: -0.35em))
```
But this is not really a satisfying solution, because it seems arbitrary. :thinking:

posts.name: Kevio
posts.cooked: If you look at the docs for quote, it mentions that the quote element is styled with pad unlike most other elements which means you can enable/disable padding with a show-set rule like this: #show quote.where(block: true): set pad(left: 1em, right: 0em)
posts.raw: If you look at the docs for `quote`, it mentions that the quote element is styled with `pad` unlike most other elements which means you can enable/disable padding with a show-set rule like this: `#show quote.where(block: true): set pad(left: 1em, right: 0em)`
